column1: The Pit Room////Every list of great barbecue that I see that doesn't have Pit Room at the top is strange to me. Brisket
column4: but there isn't a weak link in the menu. My normal gripe with bbq places is that there isn't a good way to enjoy a reasonable portion of food
column5: so you can only go when you're super hungry. That is not true here
column6: because they have great taco options. It's not just the meat that is great in the tacos
column7: even the tortillas are clearly made in house and fresh. In fact
column8: all the sides are carefully crafted
column9: curated. You can tell someone put an awful lot of thought into every last detail of the menu in this place.
